title: AHA Scientific Statement 2022: EVT and Thrombolysis in AIS With Premorbid Disability or Dementia

recommendations.text: Premorbid disability and dementia are common in AIS, but randomized trial evidence is limited because these patients are often excluded.
European guidelines note uncertain benefit when prestroke mRS >=2; AHA/ASA suggests reperfusion may be reasonable in selected cases despite less improvement and higher mortality.
Observational data do not show consistent increases in sICH risk with IVT or EVT among patients with prestroke disability or dementia.
Some studies show higher mortality and lower return to baseline after IVT; EVT outcomes show similar accumulated disability compared with those without disability.
Avoid automatic exclusion based on prestroke disability; consider intersectionality, bias, and individual values in shared decision-making.
